result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald Wayne Carver

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Reginald Wayne Carver not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed an Attorney. Court ordered case adjourned for a CAUSE for status of counsel.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Reginald Wayne Carver appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Reginald Wayne Carver appeared by video, in custody at Kenosha County.  Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood appeared by video for Reginald Wayne Carver.  Attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.comshe/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued. MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
